    The 20 best candle brands to know about in 2025 — from under-the-radar gems to luxe classics

    Written by Jaclyn Turner edited by Lauren Savoie

    Candles make great gifts for birthdays, holidays, housewarmings, thank yous, and other occasions. The right scent or candle can also make a lasting impression on your home and decor.

    Whether you're after a signature scent or love exploring up-and-coming candle makers, our guide to the best place to buy candles is a testament that you can never have too many candles — you'll want to try all of these amazing options. The best candle brands are based on our team's collective love for good candles and our own experiences.  We look for sustainable practices and high-quality materials, good throw (how well a scent fills a room), and unique, tantalizing scents.

    Fragrance preference is personal; whether you love fruity notes, like to keep it fresh and simple, or want a signature woodsy scent wafting through your home — we've got you covered in terms of the best candle scents. For other great ways to bring scent into your home, try one of the best essential oil diffusers or the best reed diffuser for a constant stream of long-lasting fragrance. 

    Best places to buy candles

    • Anthropologie: A candle lover's dream featuring exclusive in-house designs and beloved brands like Capri Blue, Voluspa, and Anecdote.
    • Bloomingdale's: A destination for top brands with over 900 candles, including Jo Malone, LAFCO, Byredo, Diptyque, and more.
    • Etsy: Shop unique candles from small businesses and makers.
    • Nordstrom: A vast array of luxury and top candle brands featuring Jo Malone, Diptyque, NEST NY, Replica, Le Labo, Voluspa, and more. 
    • Sephora: Not just for beauty; shop Voluspa, Nest, Maison Louis Marie, and more.
    • Amazon: With over 20,000 candles, Amazon offers mainstream brands, small businesses and luxury options from Chesapeake Bay to Harlem Candle Co.
    • Target: Browse affordable scents from Target-exclusive brands, plus Yankee Candle, Grove Co., Mrs. Meyers, and more.

    The best candle brands

    Voluspa

    Where to buy: Voluspa, Amazon, Anthropologie, Nordstrom

    Known for their textured jars and patterned tins, Voluspa candles are great for gifting. The thick glass and embossed exterior make each one feel like a statement piece. Plus, the jars are sturdy and attractive enough to be repurposed once your candle burns through.

    Voluspa also introduced candle refills on a number of its classics scents to reduce waste and make it more affordable to continue buying a favorite scent.

    Voluspa has a number has a number of scents, from springlike Mountain Lavender and Chamomile to timeless Santal Vanille, and each candle is hand-poured in California with a coconut-wax blend. Voluspa is a longtime favorite of BI editors; we loved how the scents diffused throughout the room without becoming overpowering and evenly burned in their vessels…no tunneling here. 

    Voluspa candles come in many shapes and sizes, depending on your budget and how much candle you're after, from a 4-ounce mini tin to a show-stopping five-wick 123-ounce vessel with 250 hours of burn time. The Voluspa website makes it easy to shop by favorite scent, fragrance profile, or product type.

    Worth a look:
    Voluspa French Cade Lavender Large Jar Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Anthropologie
    Voluspa Mediterranean Lemon Large Jar Candle
    Check price at Anthropologie Check price at Voluspa
    Voluspa Saijo Persimmon Three-Wick Tin Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom

    Otherland

    Where to buy: Otherland, Amazon

    Great for gifting or as a treat to yourself, Otherland candles have become a top choice among millennials thanks to their beautiful packaging, art-forward labels, and reusable vessels, coupled with unique, long-lasting scents. Otherland uses a hand-poured signature blend of coconut and soy wax; on average, its eight-ounce candles offer a 55-hour burn time. Each vessel has a lid, which should not be used to extinguish the flame.  

    They recently halved their pricing, and 8 ounce candles are now just $20, which is an extremely good value.

    The Core Collection represents the Otherland essentials, with popular scents including Rattan, a blend of sandalwood, amber, and musk, or Chandelier, with Champagne, leather, and saffron scents. Or feel decadent with limited collections like the Beach or Gilded collections, Matchpoint, a combination of yes, tennis balls, cut grass, and cucumber is both light and refreshing.

    If you can't quite decide, you can build a three-pack and save 10%. Choose from signature (white gift box with artwork) or eco-friendly and recyclable packaging. Both include a complimentary matchbox.

    Worth a look:
    Otherland Core Collection Chandelier Candle
    Check price at Otherland
    Otherland Core Collection: Rattan
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Otherland
    Otherland Clean Blossom Candle
    Check price at Otherland

    Hotel Lobby Candle

    Where to buy: Hotel Lobby Candle, Neiman Marcus, Anthropologie

    Hotel Lobby Candle has shown me that it's OK to be a candle snob. Founded by Lindsay Silberman, a lifestyle and travel influencer, and her husband, the idea emerged from staying home during the pandemic: bring the scents of their favorite hotels and destinations home. Hotel Lobby Candle is a testament to their top  travel hotel experiences and has some of the loveliest scents I've come across. They are fragrant but not overpowering, effortlessly fill the room, and burn gorgeously in reusable glass vessels.

    Detail is everything with these candles, from the impeccable packaging to the high-quality materials. Each candle is made of natural soy wax derived from US-grown soybeans and a combination of phthalate-free essential oils and fragrance oils that adhere to RIFM and IFRA standards for fragrance safety and purity.

    Hotel Lobby has developed a loyal following and often sell out on launch day. They've since expanded into reed diffusers, handsoap, and even perfume. The Signature scent is inspired by luxury hotels with a spicy mix of agarwood, vetiver, atlas cedar, amber, and white musk. I was drawn to the gorgeous Linen candle, a fresh blend of pink pepper, linen, sandalwood, iris, and vetiver that lingers with just a hint of sweetness.

    Worth a look:
    Hotel Lobby Signature Candle
    Check price at Neiman Marcus Check price at Hotel Lobby
    Hotel Lobby Linen Candle
    Check price at Neiman Marcus Check price at Hotel Lobby
    Hotel Lobby Candle London
    Check price at Hotel Lobby Candle

    Malin + Goetz

    Where to buy: Malin + Goetz, Amazon, Bloomingdale's, Nordstrom

    If you've already heard of Malin + Goetz, it's either because you love their deodorant or you already know about its viral Cannabis candle, with its deliciously grassy scent and deep brownish-green wax. The brand makes some of the best-smelling candles (and body products) we've ever experienced, with sophisticated scents that fill the entire room. The candles are hand-poured in Brooklyn with an even, slow burn that lasts 60 hours. Explore its richer and more masculine fragrances like Leather and Dark Rum, along with brighter and fruitier offerings like Strawberry, Tomato, or Bergamot.

    What we like most is that the fragrances aren't exactly what you'd expect on the nose. The Strawberry candle, for example, has notes of pink pepper, jasmine, and red fruits — nothing like the plasticky, artificial strawberry scent a cheaper brand may evoke. They make beautiful gifts, but if our experience is an example, you might want to buy two and keep one for yourself.

    Worth a look:
    Malin + Goetz Cannabis Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Malin + Goetz
    Malin + Goetz Strawberry Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Malin + Goetz
    Malin + Goetz Dark Rum
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Malin + Goetz

    Capri Blue

    Where to buy: Capri Blue, Amazon, Anthropologie, Nordstrom

    Whether you want a simple candle with a clean scent for under $10 or a fancy and colorful jar to display or gift, Capri Blue has options for you.

    If the brand sounds familiar, it may be because it makes Anthropologie's signature scent, Volcano, which the stores burn all day, every day. The captivating fragrance is a perfect blend of sugared citrus and tropical fruits. It's so renowned that it's available in body care like lip balm, lotion, and even laundry detergent. 

    There are 48-ounce jumbo jars that burn up to 100 hours, decorative mini tins, 19-ounce signature tins in colors from soothing blue to bubblegum pink, chic glass jars, and more. Scents equally run the gamut, from floral Aloha Orchid to smoky Havana Vanilla.

    Worth a look:
    Capri Blue Volcano Signature Jar Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Anthropologie Check price at Capri Blue
    Capri Blue Pumpkin Dulce Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Capri Blue
    Capri Blue Aloha Orchid Signature Jar Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Capri Blue

    NEST New York

    Where to buy: NEST NY, Amazon, Nordstrom, Bloomingdale's

    NEST New York candles easily add to your decor thanks to their simple but elegant glass holders. Plus, they all arrive in attractive boxes, making them a nice option for gifting.

    You can choose from large three-wick options, small minis, or classic single-wick candles, depending on your budget. Nest offers festive options like Holiday Classic and complex aromas that work year-round, like Moroccan Amber. In fact, NEST's Holiday Scent has the distinction of being top selling prestige candle in the US for two years in a row, according to research from Circana, and it's only available for a limited period throughout the year.

    Worth a look:
    Nest New York Moroccan Amber Classic Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Nordstrom Check price at NEST NY
    Nest New York Himalayan Salt & Rosewater Classic Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Nest New York
    Nest New York Grapefruit Classic Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Nest New York

    Diptyque

    Where to buy: Diptyque, Nordstrom, Bloomingdales, Neiman Marcus

    French fragrance company Diptyque is practically synonymous with luxury candles and has been perfecting the art of candle making for over 60 years. Though pricey, its options exude effortless elegance in both looks and scents. They've also taken extra efforts to be more sustainable and responsibly sourced by making all their raw ingredients traceable. Classic favorites like the Baies scent (berries) make for excellent gifts (they've long been my go-to housewarming gift), and the colorful glass and ceramic candle jars will win you compliments. 

    If you're vigilant enough to check for its annual limited-edition city candle collection, which usually sells out fast, you can score decor-worthy candles featuring aromas that will transport you to Tokyo or Berlin from the comfort of your living room. You'll also find limited edition pop-up collections throughout the year and exquisite accessories to bolster your candle-burning experience.

    Worth a look:
    Diptyque Baies/Berries Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Diptyque
    Diptyque Feu De Bois/Wood Fire Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Bloomingdale's Check price at Diptyque
    Diptyque Ambre/Amber Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Diptyque

    Homesick

    Where to buy: Homesick, Amazon,

    Scent ties memories to a specific place or moment in time, and Homesick capitalizes on this notion with carefully curated candles that bring you the scent of a specific favorite place, celebration, or memory. The brand features fragrances based on every US state, plus many popular cities and countries. It even has aromas to remind you of specific moments and favorite memories, such as Ski Trip, Tennis League, and Grandma's Kitchen. Homesick also offers up several pop culture collaborations, from the White Lotus Room Service candle to the Harry Potter Platform 9 ¾ Candle , and even capturing the zeitgeist of a visit to Emerald City.

    Each natural soy wax blend candle is 13.75 ounces with a 60-80 hour burn time and comes in a simple glass jar with a distinct black-and-white label. You can also personalize each candle with a message of your choosing. The artful outer packaging, however, makes for a fabulous gift. 

    Read our full Homesick Candles review.

    Worth a look:
    Homesick Brunch Club Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Homesick
    Homesick Georgia Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Homesick
    Homesick Love Letters Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Nordstorm Check price at Homesick

    Flamingo Estate

    Where to buy: Flamingo Estate, Bloomingdale's

    There's a certain lifestyle that I envision when I light a Flamingo Estate candle. With its unique, fresh-forward scents, I'm transported to the countryside or a villa on a summer's day. In fact, Flamingo Estate is an entire lifestyle brand, inspired by founder Richard's lush Los Angeles estate. There, they produce olive oil, honey, body care products, and more, which feature ingredients sourced from its network of over 120 farms. Candles are a standout, made of hand-poured vegetable wax in a sleek green glass vessel with a logo sticker on one side and an etching on the other.

    Tomato candles are having a moment, and the brand's Roma Heirloom Tomato Candle is fresh and bright, with an earthy aroma that transports me to a vegetable garden. Adriatic Muscatel Sage Candle awakens my senses, and takes me right to my spice drawer with its intense herbal scent.

    Worth a look:
    Flamingo Estate Roma Heirloom Tomato Candle
    Check price at Flamingo Estate
    Flamingo Estate The Three Sisters Candle Set
    Check price at Flamingo Estate Check price at Bloomingale's
    Flamingo Estate Night Blooming Jasmine & Damask Rose Candle
    Check price at Flamingo Estate

    LAFCO

    Where to buy: LAFCO, Amazon, Bloomingdale's

    When I asked my colleagues about their favorite candle brands, several leaped at the chance to tell me about LAFCO, which stands for Luxury Articles and Fragrance Company. The company was inspired by the European tradition of botanical-based fragrances and formulations. I had the chance to meet founder and lead perfumer Jon Bresler, and jis passion for scent and deep fragrance knowledge was evident from the start.

    These candles use premium, chemical-free ingredients like 100% cotton wicks, essential oils, and non-toxic soy wax. The 6.5-ounce size burns up to 50 hours, but you can also choose 1.9, 4, 15.5, and 30-ounce sizes.

    What makes them a favorite around our office are the gorgeous, hand-blown glass jars, which come in shiny, candy-apple reds and deep and nuanced cerulean blues that can easily be repurposed and reused. These candles are eye-catching and sure to steal the show, whether they're part of your decor or just adding to spruce up your home office. 

    However, their rich, layered fragrances continue the sensory experience. For instance, the bespoke ABSOLUTE collection uses a complex process of extraction and concentration rooted in 18th-century French perfumery practices where freshly harvested flowers are absorbed within sheets of lard or tallow and then continuously replenished until the desired fragrance saturation is reached. This is evidenced in the Lavender Flower Candle, featuring lavender harvested from Provence, France, with a "honeyed sweetness" mixed with herbal notes.

    Meanwhile, their Source and Story Collection highlights the makers and ingredients indigenous to their communities, like the Madagascar Geranium Bourbon, which is sourced from a farm in Madagascar and offers a fresh, yet spicy aroma.

    Worth a look:
    Lafco Library Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Lafco
    Lafco Rosemary Eucalyptus
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Lafco Check price at Bluemercury
    Lafco Fresh Cut Gardenia
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Bloomingdale's Check price at Lafco

    Mrs. Meyer's

    Where to buy: Amazon, Target, Walmart

    Mrs. Meyer's is most well-known for soaps and cleaning supplies. But the brand also makes simple candles that will leave your house smelling fresh and clean. While the candles may not come in fancy containers, they're under $10 and smell great. If you want something that looks a little nicer, you can also opt for the small tins with cute illustrations. 

    The candles also use soy and vegetable wax, and the glass jars can be repurposed once you're done burning. Choose from crisp scents like Honeysuckle, Lemon Verbena, Basil Soy, and more that match its popular soap and cleaning products.

    Worth a look: 
    Mrs. Meyer's Honeysuckle Large Jar Candle
    Check price at Amazon
    Mrs. Meyer's Lemon Verbena Soy Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Walmart
    Mrs. Meyer's Basil Tin Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Walmart Check price at Mrs. Meyer's
    Mrs. Meyer's Orange Clove Tin Candle
    Check price at Amazon

    Jo Malone

    Where to buy: Jo Malone, Nordstrom, Bloomingdale's, Sephora

    This luxury British fragrance brand likely makes the perfume worn by your effortlessly cool (and rich) friend. The same delicious and layered scents can also be found in its candle collections.

    The beautifully scented candles are housed in simple glass jars that are more timeless than wow-worthy. But that can be a plus if you're seeking a decor-neutral option that's still sophisticated. Each arrives in a gift-worthy box.

    As you might expect, these candles don't come cheap. For a more affordable option, you can opt for a travel-size candle. The scent will still pack a sweet punch even in a smaller size.

    Worth a look:
    Jo Malone London Pomegranate Noir Scented Home Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Jo Malone
    Jo Malone English Pear & Freesia Travel Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Jo Malone
    Jo Malone Lime Basil & Mandarin Deluxe Candle
    Check price at Neiman Marcus Check price at Jo Malone

    Anecdote

    Where to buy: Anecdote Candles, Amazon

    Need a last-minute but fun birthday gift or still racking your brain for what to bring to your friend's virtual housewarming party? Anecdote Candles are just the ticket.

    There are humorous scents for all occasions, and the descriptions of what each candle smells like are even funnier than the names. Options include Quarter-Life Crisis (smells like all panic and no disco), Bottomless Mimosas (smells like good vibes and fresh gossip), and Old Flame (smells like bad mistakes and repeat offenders). 

    Each candle comes in a simple glass jar, gray tumbler or tin. To help find your perfect candle, the interactive Discover Quiz matches you (or your recipient) to the perfect scent.

    Worth a look:
    Anecdote Candles Adulting
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Anecdote Candles
    Anecdote Candles Comfort Zone
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Anecdote Candles
    Anecdote Candles Vinyl Records
    Check price at Anecdote Candles

    WoodWick

    Where to buy: Amazon, Kohl's, Walmart

    The signature of WoodWick is their wooden wicks, which make a crackling sound while they burn, reminiscent of listening to a nearby cozy fire. It's a multi-sensory experience that brings together smell, sound, and sight. The candles are remarkably affordable too — a medium nine ounce candle typically costs under $20 — and are made of a soy and parrafin wax blend.

    Scents span from woody classics like Fraser Fir that transport you to a campfire in the mountains to the gourmand like Cafe Sweets Trilogy, a trio of vanilla bean, caramel and biscotti that are layered and uniquely blend into each other as the candles burn.

    Worth a look:
    WoodWick Trilogy Cafe Sweets
    Check price at Amazon
    WoodWick Coastal Sunset Large Hourglass Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Kohl's
    WoodWick Lavender & Cedar Medium Hourglass Candle
    Check price at Amazon

    Harlem Candle Company

    Where to buy: Amazon

    Harlem Candle Company's signature 12-ounce candles burn for up to 80 hours in opulently designed glass vessels, but what sets them apart are the accompanying backstories. Harlem Candle Company is the brainchild of lifestyle and travel expert Teri Johnson. Each one is named for a historical spot and person with ties to Harlem, where the candles are also made.

    For example, the Savoy candle highlights the iconic Savoy Ballroom, evoking a glitzy nightlife scene via rich notes of blackcurrant, Mandarin, green apple, and juicy pear, along with Lily of the Valley, jasmine petals, and sandalwood. The Lady Day candle is inspired by the incomparable Billie Holiday, a floral gardenia scent accented with lush green leaves, neroli, and bergamot.

    Worth a look:
    Harlem Candle Co. Lady Day Candle
    Check price at Amazon
    Harlem Candle Company Home Luxury Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Bloomingdale's
    Harlem Candle Co. Speakeasy Candle
    Check price at Amazon

    Le Labo

    Where to buy: Le Labo, Nordstrom, Saks Fifth Avenue

    Le Labo is beloved for its complex fragrances and rejection of standard perfume practices, with a scientific precision rooted in craftsmanship and special attention to ingredients and customization. What started as a perfumery where each perfume is freshly created at the in-store laboratory, hand-blended, and bottled, has expanded into a beloved home fragrance with a cult-like following. All of Le Labo's fragrances use the main ingredient as the name. 

    The Santal Collection is one of its best-known scents, and you can opt for the rich scent of sandalwood with a leathery and smoky sensation in a classic glass jar, concrete holder, mini trio, or as a vintage look with an expertly crumpled tin can option. You can even personalize the label, the date, and your name for an extra-special touch when purchased directly from Le Labo. All candles are hand-poured in Mississippi.

    Worth a look:
    Le Labo Cedre 11 Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Saks Fifth Avenue
    Le Labo Santal 26 Classic Candle
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at Saks Fifth Avenue

    Bath & Body Works

    Where to buy: Bath & Body Works

    Bath & Body Works has long been known for its scented candles with a loyal fan base. But if you haven't looked at its candles for several years, you might be surprised at how much the shop has upped its branding game. Striking glass jars with three-wick candles and elegant labels are not only worthy of sitting out on the coffee table, but they will also last you months and are an excellent value.

    Between a rotation of signature and seasonal scents, Bath & Body Works constantly keeps things fresh by constantly releasing new decorative containers.

    Those who can't seem to stop burning through their candles will take delight in the new Scent-scription offering, which will save you 25% and the option to replenish between every one and six months — so you'll never run out of your favorite candle.

    Worth a look:
    Bath and Body Works Mahogany Teakwood Intense
    Check price at Bath and Body Works
    Bath & Body Works Champagne Toast Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at Bath & Body Works
    Bath & Body Works Spring Apple Candle
    Check price at Bath & Body Works

    D.S. & Durga

    Where to buy: D.S. & Durga, Amazon, Neiman Marcus

    When a married self-taught perfumer and an architect come together, you get D.S. and Durga, a brand that uses the power of scent to create narratives. Its founders, David and Kavi Moltz have become celebrities among the fragrance world with their particular, but not too stuffy approach to creating a fragrance house. 

    The candles, showstoppers on their own merit, are housed in amber-colored glass vessels with a white graphic label, creating an eye-catching effect. The 7-ounce candles are made of soy-vegetable wax with a cotton wick, promising up to 60 hours of burn time. 

    Mainstays include Big Sur After Rain, bringing together eucalyptus, wet wood, and rainwater to emulate the quiet and calming mood following a rainstorm, while Be Still Candle explores the spirituality of meditation with it's incense forward scent. The pairings are ultimately abstract and unexpected; a fragrance experience like none other.

    Worth a look:
    D.S. & Durga Big Sur After Rain
    Check price at D.S. & Durga
    D.S. & Durga Portable Fireplace
    Check price at Nordstrom Check price at D.S. & Durga
    D.S. & Durga Wild Brooklyn Lavender
    Check price at D.S. & Durga

    Candier

    Where to buy: Candier by Ryan Porter, Amazon, Ulta

    If Candier candles were given a persona, they would be the life of the party. These colorful and highly fragranced candles feature engaging messages printed on the label and have splashy names. The signature Calm the F Down candle combines notes of cherry blossom and sandalwood, while the Matcha My Freak is made in small batches of 150 candles with scent notes of matcha, brown sugar, and vanilla. It's handpoured with realistic gel "ice cubes" and boba.

    Many of the maximalist designs feature original details like biodegradable glitter, sprinkles, and special wax additions in fun shapes like donuts to flowers. If you gravitate toward sweet or fruity scents, you'll love Candier. Feeling adventurous? Try your luck with a mystery candle. College students and those living in apartments with open flame restrictions will obsess over the dormables collection, wickless candles designed to be used with warming lamps.

    Worth a look:
    Candier Calm the F Down Candle
    Check price at Candier
    Candier Apres Pickleball Candle
    Check price at Candier
    Candier Espresso Obsesso Coffee Candle
    Check price at Candier

    54Celsius

    Where to buy: 54Celsius, Amazon, Etsy

    54Celsius places the designer of the candle front in the center of its product lineup, putting an emphasis on detail, and resulting in unexpected candle designs that are meant to be proudly displayed as art pieces. There is no limit as to what can be done with wax here, with the brand working with emerging designers, artists, and craftspeople to develop beautiful and unexpected products. 

    54Celsius holds collaborations with the iconic Lex Pott and his social-media darling Twist candle. You'll want to check out the intriguing PyroPets, an animal-shaped candle mold that, when melted down, reveals a metal skeleton. There are also Buon Appetito food-shaped candles — think cupcakes, baguettes, and wine bottles — made in Italy to consider, or CandleCans, novelty scented candles deftly sculpted into shapes like berries, chocolate, and beans in a tin. 

    For such complicated shapes, each product arrived well-packaged in recyclable or compostable packaging, and they all feature intentional, traceable candle ingredients.

    Worth a look:
    54Celsius Lex Pott Twist Candle
    Check price at Etsy Check price at 54Celsius
    54Celsius Heart Burn Candle
    Check price at Etsy Check price at 54Celsius
    54Celsius PyroPet Einar Unicorn Candle
    Check price at Amazon Check price at 54Celsius

When she's not working, she can be found perusing the aisles of Homegoods, scrolling TikTok for too long, and trying out local Atlanta restaurants. Connect with Jaclyn at jturner@businessinsider.com or give her a follow on Instagram @jaclynturnerLearn more about how our team of experts tests and reviews products at Insider here.
